articles.author: Babak Dehghanpisheh
articles.title: Iran denies shooting at protesters amid fury over downing of plane
articles.description: Iran's police said on Monday officers had not fired at protesters demonstrating over Tehran's admission that it shot down a passenger plane, as video on social media recorded gunshots and pools of blood.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran’s police said on Monday officers had not fired at protesters demonstrating over Tehran’s admission that it shot down a passenger plane, as video on social media recorded gunshots and pools of blood. 
U.S. President Donald Trump, tweeti… [+4557 chars]

articles.author: Rania El Gamal
articles.title: Saudi energy minister: We want sustainable oil prices
articles.description: Saudi Arabia, OPEC's de facto leader, will work for oil market stability at a time of heightened U.S.-Iranian tension and wants to see sustainable prices and demand growth, the kingdom's energy minister said on Monday.
articles.content:
DHAHRAN, Saudi Arabia (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia, OPEC’s de facto leader, will work for oil market stability at a time of heightened U.S.-Iranian tension and wants to see sustainable prices and demand growth, the kingdom’s energy minister said on Monday. 
Prin… [+1650 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi Arabia committed to oil market stability - energy minister
articles.description: Saudi Arabian Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman said on Monday the kingdom, the world's top crude exporter, would do "all it can" to ensure oil market stability at a time of heightened tension in the region.
articles.content:
DHAHRAN, Saudi Arabia (Reuters) - Saudi Arabian Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman said on Monday the kingdom, the world’s top crude exporter, would do “all it can” to ensure oil market stability at a time of heightened tension in the region. 
“Ther… [+315 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Royal showdown: queen to chair crisis talks over Meghan and Harry
articles.description: Queen Elizabeth and her heirs will meet Prince Harry on Monday to thrash out a plan for Harry and Meghan after the couple triggered a royal crisis by announcing they would be stepping back from their duties and spending more time in North America.
articles.content: SANDRINGHAM, England (Reuters) - Queen Elizabeth and her heirs will meet Prince Harry on Monday to thrash out a plan for Harry and Meghan after the couple triggered a royal crisis by announcing they would be stepping back from their duties and spending more t… [+1435 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Ugandan shilling stronger on back of commodity flows
articles.description: The Ugandan shilling strengthened on Monday on the back of some hard currency inflows from exporters of commodities like tea, coffee and gold, traders said.
articles.content:
KAMPALA, Jan 13 (Reuters) - The Ugandan shilling strengthened on Monday on the back of some hard currency inflows from exporters of commodities like tea, coffee and gold, traders said. 
At 0837 GMT commercial banks quoted the shilling at 3,665/3,675, compare… [+539 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: S.Africa's Massmart says in talks to close some stores, could cut 1,440 jobs
articles.description: South Africa's Massmart Holdings, majority owned by U.S. retail giant Walmart , said on Monday it was in consultations with unions and other stakeholders to close up to 34 stores, which could lead to up to 1,440 job losses.
articles.content:
JOHANNESBURG, Jan 13 (Reuters) - South Africa’s Massmart Holdings, majority owned by U.S. retail giant Walmart , said on Monday it was in consultations with unions and other stakeholders to close up to 34 stores, which could lead to up to 1,440 job losses. 
… [+290 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Law firm Schirp says it's applying for special audit of Wirecard
articles.description: Law firm Schirp said on Monday it was applying for a special audit of German payments company Wirecard, which is facing allegations of fraud and false accounting, on behalf of its shareholders.
articles.content:
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Law firm Schirp said on Monday it was applying for a special audit of German payments company Wirecard, which is facing allegations of fraud and false accounting, on behalf of its shareholders. 
Wirecard was hit a year ago by allegation… [+572 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: European shares flat as focus turns to Sino-U.S. trade deal
articles.description: European shares started Monday on a subdued note as markets awaited the signing of a Sino-U.S. trade deal later in the week, while technology stocks rose on a clutch of brokerage upgrades and price-target bumps.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - European shares started Monday on a subdued note as markets awaited the signing of a Sino-U.S. trade deal later in the week, while technology stocks rose on a clutch of brokerage upgrades and price-target bumps.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: No room for two team events in two months, says Nadal
articles.description: World number one Rafa Nadal has called on tennis administrators to create one "big world team cup competition" instead of confusing fans by staging the ATP Cup and Davis Cup within two months of each other.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - World number one Rafa Nadal has called on tennis administrators to create one “big world team cup competition” instead of confusing fans by staging the ATP Cup and Davis Cup within two months of each other.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: France and Russia want to safeguard Iran nuclear deal, Macron says
articles.description: France and Russia have a shared desire to safeguard Iran's nuclear deal, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - France and Russia have a shared desire to safeguard Iran’s nuclear deal, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday. 
Macron said in a statement he had a phone call on Sunday with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: More than 400,000 German jobs at risk in switch to electric cars - Handelsblatt
articles.description: The shift to electric vehicles could cost 410,000 jobs in Germany by 2030, daily Handelsblatt reported on Monday, citing government advisers.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - The shift to electric vehicles could cost 410,000 jobs in Germany by 2030, daily Handelsblatt reported on Monday, citing government advisers. 
In engines and transmissions’ production alone, around 88,000 jobs will be at risk, the newspape… [+1071 chars]

articles.title: China could flex military muscles to pressure Taiwan post-election
articles.description: His policies rejected by Taiwan voters in a landslide re-election for President Tsai Ing-wen, Chinese President Xi Jinping will most likely continue to tighten the screws on the island, with state media already floating shows of force.
articles.content:
